phrases: I had lost my way during my journey.
Only my soul was wandering, while I stood still.
But right now, I am walking to a distant place.
That is right, ever since I met you on this road.
The travellers witnessed the song, the forbidden song,
And I became attached to it as I heard it alone with you.
If the world I saw in my dreams exists somewhere,
Let us go search for it, beyond the winds.
Whether it is a freezing dawn,
A dry midday,
A shivering night,
or the ends of the Earth, let us go and see it.
Yeah, while I was on my way here from Rubinhaigen,
it had already become a famous rumor.
That is right, it is scary, you know.
That magician near that newly-made detour road, right?
I heard about it too.
He summons wolves and commands them as if they were dogs,
and attacks travelers to collect their blood!
That cannot be true.
No, you should seriously be careful.
This is a story I heard from someone who is with the church in Rubinhaigen,
but two weeks ago, an entire caravan was wiped out.
Ah, scary, how scary!
It is scary so I am going to drink more!
I guess I will keep it in mind.
I pray the magician is not a woman, then.
Why is that?
You are easily deceived by women.
You are also easily seduced, even if it means you will get hurt.
Ever since then, the price of beer has certainly increased.
Ah, hey!
The Medioh Company must be a huge topic in bars.
Men really are foolish creatures.
Sorry for being an idiot.
Wolf and Righteous Scale
What an insolent city!
Bars close far too early!
That is because this place is under the control of the Church and Rubinhaigen.
At least they have bars intended for travelers.
You mean it is a city that is only interested in living humbly and praying to God?
The Church's sermons about virtues, that put you to sleep, are like this city's greeting.
I do not understand what is so fun about it.
After I sell the pepper and load up some new cargo, I will take you to Rubinhaigen.
Is it a large town?
Yeah.
It is larger than Pattsio.
It is more of a city than a town.
It is lively, and there are a lot of street stalls.
Do they have apples?
I am not sure about fresh ones.
It is almost winter, so it is about the time they preserve them.
Preserve?
They do not use salt, you know, they use honey!
And it is not just apples, preserved pears in honey are also good.
Also, in newer areas, they use peaches.
Peaches...
They cut the peaches into thin slices and pack them into a barrel.
The high-class versions of the product might even have almonds in them.
They then pour a lot of honey on top and a bit of ginger at the bottom,
and then store it for about two months.
The sweetness you taste when you put it in your mouth is a sweetness that is almost otherworldly.
The Church prohibits it, though, because of their doctrines-
Hey, you are drooling.
You are not lying, are you?
I am not lying, but
generally, only the rich or noble can buy them.
Stores do not put them on display often.
W-What if they put it on display?
What would happen if they put it on display?
A-All right, I will buy it for you.
You would better!
But only a little.
It is a promise, okay?
H-Hey, are you listening?
Let us go, then.
Let us go quickly.
Go where?
We will go to the inn, get on the wagon, and go to that whatever-company, of course.
We will strike the doors until the master awakens, sell the pepper at a high price,
and then immediately depart for Rubinhaigen!
Wait, wait, at a time like this?
It might be sold out, so all the more reason to go now.
There is a higher chance of it not being sold rather than being sold out.
Peaches with honey!
I cannot believe this.
I just cannot believe it!
That is only if we are lucky!
But...
It will be hard for me to give up the pears as well.
We have not taken that priest's story too much to heart.
It is truly a meeting that God has sent to us.
I wish to impart those words to you as an expression of the devotional feelings that reside in my heart.
Well, I talked a bit too long, so shall we get down to business?
Please.
What goods did you bring us today?
This here.
Pepper, is it?
I am surprised you could tell.
It is the smell.
I am amazed.
No, no, it is something I learned after doing this for so long.
By the way, did you bring a scale?
No, I did not, but...
I believe in God.
But still, it is quite frustrating.
The demand for pepper has been rising lately.
If you had come a week earlier, I could have bought the pepper cheaper.
Then I have come at a good time?
Yes.
Well then, let us weigh the pepper.
Yes, please do.
Then I will need some paper and ink, so please wait a bit.
What is it?
I am thirsty.
Just bear with it.
Would water be okay with you?
We also have wine.
Ah, could I have some water?
A simple request.
The weight comes to 45 units.
Where did this pepper come from?
Ramapata from the the Kingdom of Riedon.
It was imported by the Milone Company.
Ramapata is known prominently for their spices, is not it?
Also, there is no mistaking that this certificate is authentic.
Well then, how about one Rumione gold coin for each unit?
What is the market price for Rumione gold coins?
Would Thoreni silver coins be fine?
Yes.
In Thoreni silver coins...
It would be 32 and 5/6 coins.
That would be by my estimation.
Then I will go with that price.
Ah, well then...
What is wrong?
I am a bit dizzy...
A-Are you all right?
Y-Yes...
Are you better now?
A bit, thank you.
It must be the weariness from your long travels.
I will bring you some goat milk now.
Excuse me...
For some reason, everything seems to be on a slant to me.
How does it all look to you?
No, I would never...
I am sure it is not, but...
Hey, are you okay?
I see something that cannot be real!
It looks like I was drinking wine earlier, rather than water.
Is not that right, sir?
There is a proverb that says you should not drink more than the cheerful bar master.
I understand it now.
The secret to a thriving business is to be the sober one in that situation, correct?
It seems I am drunk too.
I will probably forget all that I have seen and heard here.
But when I am drunk, I tend to talk quite a bit.
W-What are you...
The money here, the profit you tried to make off me, and...
Let us see, to buy my trust, you will give me double the amount of what I was buying.
Double?!
T-That is too much!
Ah, how unfortunate, I am becoming sober.
The commodity will be...
Let us see, money is money, so how about some high-grade armor?
Armor?
It is a safe and standard commodity that will guarantee a profit.
And with this, I can return the money I borrowed immediately.
You have a lot of commodities for Rubinhaigen, do not you?
Armor, huh?
There is a company that is friendly with me in Rubinhaigen,
so the lending and borrowing would counterbalance.
How about it?
Thank you very much.
Well then, could you make arrangements for the goods now?
I would like to depart for Rubinhaigen as soon as possible.
I-I understand.
What about the audit?
I will leave it to you.
I believe in God after all.
I feel sorry for him.
But still, I am amazed that you noticed.
I am beautiful, the lay of my tail is good, and I am smart.
But my ears and eyes are good too.
I smelled it right when I entered this room.
Oh?
Not Oh!
What are you doing, so suddenly?
Experience leads to trusting others too much.
And that trust can sometimes be fatal.
You should have learned that after Chloe.
That is entirely true.
You fool!
Feeling sorry for yourself is even worse!
You should just learn from it.
Oil?
Yes, I hear it is good for maintaining my tail.
Could you buy me some in the next city?
Have you ever calculated the price for those clothes you are wearing, your spare clothes, the comb,
the expenses for the inn, meals, and the absurd amounts of beer?
There is also the poll tax when we enter a city.
It is not like you cannot calculate it, right?
I can do addition.
But not only addition, I am also good at subtraction.
Then add up how much you have spent.
If you are so wise, you should be able to know the answer to my question.
I do not know.
I am sure you will buy it.
You pride yourself for being clever and wise, but you just lose face when you are drunk.
I am not drunk at all!
Hey!
What are you doing?!
Just kidding.
Hey...
It is not good to belittle me.
Do not you understand that you gained that unimaginable profit by grasping onto that master's weakness?
Will you buy me oil?
How much do you think you owe me?
140 silver coins!
You understand how much that is, right?
You think I will just buy you some more unnecessary stuff on top of that?
What?
Do you really want me to pay you back that much?
Of course!
I did not know you thought that way.
W-What do you-
Well...
Once I pay you back, I will be free.
Yeah, I should just pay you back and return to the North by myself.
Well, I am used to being alone.
I have not decided when you have to pay me back.
As long as you pay me back when we reach the northern forest, it will be fine.
Is that all right?
Yeah.
I am sure I will be able to pay you back once we reach the northern forest.
Also, I was planning to pay you back with interest.
In other words, the more I can borrow from you, the more profit you will get.
Okay?
Oil, huh?
Yes.
You can forget about my debt, so will you buy me it?
Agreed, then.
Thank you.
The weather is perfect this morning!
But you really haggled with him, did not you?
Why are you asking that?
It is not good to become a merchant that extorts.
Rubinhaigen is the best place to sell armor, but there are too many merchants who bring it in.
And because of that, the interest rate will naturally lower.
So I just haggled with him to get more.
But you bought this much, so you should have a big profit, right?
Well, we should have enough to buy oil.
That is great.
But thinking about it, spice is really good.
Did you eat it?
Do not treat me like you.
I am talking about profit.
You should have gotten more spice, then.
The price will not be any different in Rubinhaigen or Polson.
The tariff would cost me so much that I would be be at a loss.
Then you should give up on it.
If I could trade spices or something with a higher interest rate, I would have my own store by now.
Is not there something else?
For example, do not jewels and gold sell well?
There will not be much profit with those in Rubinhaigen and its vicinity.
Why is that?
The tariff is too high.
By looking at a few merchants, they get charged a high tariff when they import gold.
You cannot do any business because of it.
Why are a few merchants exempt from it?
It is a monopoly with the Church.
If you take gold to the Church there, they will carve a holy seal for you.
The blessed gold then comes with a preposterously high price.
Of course, for exempting the tariff, they receive donations.
What a splendid relationship.
That is why there is a terribly severe punishment for smuggling.
If you smuggle it, the price will double,
but in exchange, it will also be dangerous.
That is why there are not any idiots who do it.
You cannot even import gold by hiding it?
The cargo inspection is not that laid back.
What will happen if they find out?
At the worst, they will sever your dominant arm.
It is just not worth it.
Well, your business is doing well.
You just need to steadily earn money.
You are exactly right.
But there is someone who is trying to waste my steady gain of profit.
You should be careful.
It seems like a mercenary band is coming in from the north.
Mercenary band?
Yeah.
Then continuing on this path would be suicide.
Yes, they are like birds of prey and can find their game even faster than I.
If they think it will make them money,
they will take everything, not even leaving behind the ashes of tree stumps.
They have long spears, too.
I have memories of trouble with them.
What troubles me more is why they have gone out of their way to come here.
They are like us, they only move if there is something to gain.
Well, there is no use worrying about it here.
Anyway, let us take that new detour road leading to Rubinhaigen.
You are not afraid of that pagan magician, right?
There seems to be a pack of wolves on the road also.
They are easier to handle than humans.
At the least, we can talk.
Then I will leave the negotiations to you.
There is no one around.
The power of rumors are exceptionally strong.
How boring, I am going to take a nap.
You will still know if wolves come if you are asleep, right?
I can tell that much.
It will be troublesome if we are surrounded.
You are such a worry-wart.
It does not normally matter if they are awake or asleep, despite what animal it is.
It is that you humans are too defenseless when you sleep.
That is not very convincing, since you snore when you sleep.
I do not snore!
Well, it is not that loud.
I told you I do not snore!
All right already.
I told you I do not snore!
I told you, I got it!
What is wrong?
I will leave the coming negotiations to you.
What is there?
The type of humans I hate.
That magician?
Sheep?
Is that supposed to be the magician?
What was that?
It is a kind of ritual for when you meet a shepherd.
At the very least, she does not look like the magician.
I am a travelling merchant, Lawrence.
This is my traveling companion, Horo.
To the shepherd where God had guided us to meet, I hope that you pray for our safe journey.
With pleasure.
Seven apples on the witch's tree
With seven seeds to plant inside of me
In spring time I grew a magic song
Then skipping along,
I sang the song to everyone
I look at the world through apple eyes
And cut myself a slice of sunshine pie
I danced with the peanuts for the flies
Till someone had told me
To say hello for every good-bye
Saw some sugar stars
I will put them in a jar
And we will wish around the world
Oh we will wish around the world
I am a little wolf inside a cart
You say,
And off I go from June to May
Oh we will wish around the world
Let us wish around the world
Next, Wolf and the Shepherd's Lambs
Next, Wolf and the Shepherd's Lambs
